_header: Most sovereign lady comfort of care
_description: A love letter to his mistress by Humfrey Newton — one 8-line stanza (acrostic on MARGARET)

BodLatMisC66.First Lines:
Most soueren lady comfort of careA next in my hert most in my
                    myende…
BodLatMisC66.Last Lines:
…euer wel spryngynge stillatorie of swettes
                    swetenesTresore full bare gronded with grace
BodLatMisC66.Note:
Portions of last line illegible [here based on Robbins’ reading]
                    because have been written over or partly erased; preceded by note in Latin,
                        ‘Littera amandi et nomen de illa est expressum hic (f.
                        93v).
BodLatMisC66.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “The Poems of Humphrey Newton, Esquire, 1466-1536.” 
             PMLA
         65 (1950): 249-81: 266-7.
Davies,  Reginald Thorne. 
             Medieval English Lyrics: a critical anthology.
         London, 1963; Evanston, IL: Northwestern UP, 1964: 256.
